pr_title: fix #2468 Review and polish deprecation suppressions

timeline.message:
Document sensible suppressed warnings where it makes sense

Rewrite some tests otherwise

fix #2468 challenge suppressed deprecation warnings

Make NextProcessor non-deprecated itself. It is hidden from the outside
world by being package private.

Document sensible suppressed warnings where it makes sense

Rewrite some tests otherwise

Document sensible suppressed warnings where it makes sense

Rewrite some tests otherwise

timeline.bodyText: technically, it will rather be simplified into EmitterSink, only implementing Sinks.Many rather than FluxProcessor (which itself will be removed). the class will become package-private though, so "removed from the public API".
timeline.author: simonbasle

timeline.bodyText: I'd consider making sure the remove comments are easily greppable, by making them consistently end with removed in 3.5 => later on we can simply search for removed in 3.5 and find all spots that need cleanup.
timeline.author: simonbasle
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -36,6 +36,7 @@
 			.withImportOption(ImportOption.Predefined.DO_NOT_INCLUDE_JARS)
 			.importPackagesOf(CoreSubscriber.class);
 
+	// This is ok as this class tests the deprecated FluxProcessor. Will be removed with it in 3.5.

replies.bodyText: The current comment has the benefit of explaining that this will be removed as a side effect of FluxProcessor being removed. Which is really the (small) value add of this PR when you search for SuppressWarning("deprecation"). Simplifying the texts too much removes context. We can always search for removed.*3\.5 if needed, wdyt?
replies.author: ericbottard

replies.bodyText: yeah ok. my initial thought was that going the extra mile would make the search for things to remove trivial in 3.5.0, but it is probably safer to assume no consistent message and cast a wider net the day of the removal (since it will be easy to forget about the "right" message in future deprecations)
replies.author: simonbasle

replies.bodyText: note that we also have related issues to track what has to be removed in 3.5 per topic (#2478, #2207, #2204 ...)
replies.author: aneveu

timeline.bodyText: nitpick: I think IntelliJ's formatter is getting confused by the mix of tabs and spaces in this file. we should generally favor tabs for most of the colums (and let it adjust the alignment of dots with a few spaces if there is a shift of less than 4 characters)
